title: Commonwealth of Nations
subject_group: Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International cooperation
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/International relations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Political science
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Great Britain - Foreign relations
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Commonwealth of Nations
description: The nature, extent and constitution of the British Commonwealth - its purpose, benefits derived from it and the relationship among its members. The historical background is presented, beginning 200 years ago when British colonies were scattered in newly discovered lands all over the world. The seed of the Commonwealth was germinated when Canada was granted her independence. Contains historical footage of 1950s Sydney.
